title: Premier League Matchweek 2

37 Posted 22/08/2025 at 22:31:26
It was the only time I can ever remember West Ham, bringing a few thousand supporters to Goodison, and the funny bastards got it right when they continuously sang that we would be running around Wembley with fuck-all.
38 Posted 23/08/2025 at 06:40:08
Interesting to see the much-talked-about Bowen, who is a good player, on the right side of midfield, but always looking to come in on his left foot. Another inverted winger, which has now become common practice.
I was at that game in May '86. Outside, there were a few West Ham supporters on Goodison Road and Gwladys Street making their way to the Park End. Banter was healthy and they wished us well against Liverpool. Inside the ground, it got a bit spicy, especially in the corner of the Enclosure and the old Park End, which used to be given to the away supporters.
As for Potter, I spoke out against him when he was linked with us. It's too early in the season to call, but there will be pressure on him now.

You need quality on the bench to come on and make an impact, as well as covering for injuries and suspensions. The games a lot quicker and more intense and as such mid game fatigue can be punished more as well as keeping energy levels high all season by some rotation. fresh legs can also be the difference between a player choosing to drop deep to avoid having to chase back if the ball is lost and being confident enough to push forward and support or press late on
I hope we don‚Äôt start selling players or loaning to many out, it‚Äôs a long season old season
